question: Canada is the second largest country in the world
answerExtraInfo: Russia is 17,080,000 km², Canada is 9,985,000 km²

question: Toronto is the capital of Canada
answerExtraInfo: It's the capital of Ontario. Ottawa is the capital of Canada, second coldest capital in the world.

question: Jim Carrey, Shania Twain, James Cameron and Alex Trebek are all Canadian
answerExtraInfo: So are Ryan Gosling, Avril Lavigne, Michael Cera, Rachel McAdams, Seth Rogen, Pam Anderson, Steve Nash and Wolverine.

question: Queen Elizabeth II is the Canadian Head of State
answerExtraInfo: But the British Monarchy holds no real power over Canada.

question: Canada borders three other countries
answerExtraInfo: Just the one neighbor, with 8,891 kilometres of border, the longest undefended border in the world.

question: Canada has the world's longest coastline
answerExtraInfo: 200,000 - 265,000 km of it, depending on how you calculate it.

question: Canada holds the record for the most gold medals ever won at the Summer Olympics
answerExtraInfo: But they do for the Winter Olympics (2010 Vancouver Winter Olympics - 14 gold medals).

question: Hockey is the only official sport of Canada
answerExtraInfo: It is for winter. Lacrosse is Canada's official summer sport (and Canada claims to have invented Basketball.)

question: Celine Dion is the top selling female artist of all time
answerExtraInfo: She is third, only behind Madonna and Mariah Carey.

question: The Toronto Maple Leafs haven't won the Stanley Cup in over 40 years
answerExtraInfo: They haven't even made an appearance in the Stanley Cup finals since 1967.

question: Canada has the world's longest freshwater beach
answerExtraInfo: Wasaga Beach on Georgian Bay is the world’s longest at 14 km.

question: Toronto's CN Tower is the world's tallest free-standing structure
answerExtraInfo: It was for 34 years, but the Burj Khalifa and Canton Tower have since eclipsed it.

question: Poutine is a dish made from maple syrup and lobster
answerExtraInfo: That's disgusting. Poutine is French fries, cheese curds and gravy. Yummy!

question: James Doohan, famous for 'Scotty' on Star Trek, was Canadian
answerExtraInfo: And so is William Shatner, but you knew that.

question: Abraham Lincoln was president when Canada became a country
answerExtraInfo: Lincoln (died): 1865. Canada (born): 1867.

question: The current 'maple leaf' Canadian flag is older than the current US '50 stars' flag
answerExtraInfo: The Canadian flag was adopted by parliament in 1965, the US flag in 1960.

question: You can see the Rocky Mountains from Vancouver
answerExtraInfo: The Rockies are over 500km away, but you can see the North Shore Mountains.

question: The population of Spain is greater than the population of Ontario
answerExtraInfo: Greater than the entire population of Canada, actually, which is about 35 million.

question: Montreal is the world’s largest French speaking city
answerExtraInfo: Paris is. But Montreal is second.

question: Canada spans 8 time zones
answerExtraInfo: Only 6 time zones, that's enough isn't it?

question: Canada declared war on Germany in WWII at the same time as the USA
answerExtraInfo: Canada declared war a full two years before the USA, to support the UK's declaration.

question: Canada is the United States' largest supplier of crude oil
answerExtraInfo: Followed by Saudi Arabia, Mexico, Venezuela and Nigeria (2011)

question: Canada has the lowest population density in the world
answerExtraInfo: Mongolia holds that honour, by most accounts, but Canada is up there.

question: Canada contains around one-tenth of the entire world's renewable water supply
answerExtraInfo: 9% actually. That's a lot of lakes!

question: You can fit the UK inside of Hudson Bay
answerExtraInfo: A few times, if you squish it around a bit.
